title: Weekly Roundup: Friday, January 15
description: This week, a recap of Thursday night's GOP debate, a look at the new levels of competition between Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders, and — two weeks from the Iowa Caucuses — which state might really be the most demographically representative in the nation.  Plus a listener question and what the NPR Politics team can't let go.  This episode: editor and correspondent Ron Elving and campaign reporter Asma Khalid join hosts Sam Sanders and Tamara Keith.  Find them on Twitter @samsanders, @tamarakeithNPR, @asmamk, @NPRrelving, and at npr.org/politics.
